ygData.msgSnippet: I just had another idea on this. During a NEAT search my intention was to not mutate any of the neuron functions once a neuron had been created, primarily

Subject: Re: [neat] Neuron functions
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=127853030
X-Yahoo-Profile: alienseedpod

I just had another idea on this. During a NEAT search my intention was 
to not mutate any of the neuron functions once a neuron had been 
created, primarily because most of the functions are distinct from one 
another and therefore there is no smooth transition from one function to 
another. Thus most such mutations would be detrimental.

But could we actually provide a smooth evolutionary path between the 
distinct functions? One way to do this would be to calculate all of the 
functions all of the time and then apply a weighting to each one. We can 
then mutate the weights applied to each function and thus provide a 
smooth pathway between any one function and another. This also 
introduces the intriguing possibility of finding compound functions that 
describe shapes we might not have deemed useful previously.

This is all inspired by thinking about how biological neurons might 
work, although I don't know if this is what actually happens.

Colin.
